title: How to Stimulate Your Hair Follicles

steps.title: Choose if you would like to include oil in your scalp massage.
steps.content: Choose if you would like to include oil in your scalp massage. Many professionals recommend massaging oil into your scalp while you massage it. This not only stimulates your hair follicles but also nourishes your scalp and roots. [1] X Expert Source Patrick Evan Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 17 January 2019. If you don't use oil, you may end up tugging or tangling your hair. Recommended oils include: [2] X Research source Coconut oil Jojoba oil Olive oil Almond oil Egg oil (eyova) Avocado oil Castor oil

steps.title: Decide when you would like to do a scalp massage.
steps.content: Decide when you would like to do a scalp massage. You have a few options here, mainly depending on whether you would like to incorporate oil into your scalp massage. In the shower while shampooing (no oil necessary) Before showering Before bed

steps.title: Warm a small amount of your chosen oil in a ramekin.
steps.content: Warm a small amount of your chosen oil in a ramekin. [3] X Research source If you would like to massage your scalp with an oil, then warm a small amount of it. You can warm it with boiling hot water, or you can melt it in a saucepan over low heat. No more than one tablespoon of oil is recommended.

steps.title: Place your fingertips on your scalp and begin to massage in small circles.
steps.content: Place your fingertips on your scalp and begin to massage in small circles. The pads of your fingertips massage and stimulate blood flow to your scalp. If you are using oil, then dip your fingertips into the warmed oil before placing them on your scalp. Then, massage the oil into your scalp in small circles. Use only a minimum amount of oil to avoid making your hair too greasy.

steps.title: Massage all over your scalp for up to five minutes.
steps.content: Massage all over your scalp for up to five minutes. You can part your hair into sections, and massage each section for about one minute, or you can just work your way slowly all around your head. Use a variety of touches and movements. Try tapping, kneading, stroking, and rubbing your scalp. Some methods suggest flipping your head upside down while massaging to further stimulate blood flow to the scalp. This is not a proven method, so try it with caution, especially if you have health conditions such as pregnancy or frequent dizziness.

steps.title: Wrap your head in an old t-shirt, light towel, or shower cap.
steps.content: Wrap your head in an old t-shirt, light towel, or shower cap. Wrapping your hair gives the oil time to absorb into your follicles and hair shafts, providing extra nourishing power. [4] X Research source Allow your hair to stay wrapped, absorbing the oil, for up to two hours. Heavy bath towels tend to cause hair breakage, so good alternatives for wrapping your hair include old cotton t-shirts or light microfiber towels. This step is not necessary if you did not use oil while massaging your scalp.

steps.title: Wash your hair thoroughly, if you used oil.
steps.content: Wash your hair thoroughly, if you used oil. No matter what type of hair you have, too much oil in it will make it greasy. This is especially true if you have fine hair, for which oils are usually too heavy. Shampoo and condition your hair as you normally would. [5] X Expert Source Patrick Evan Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 17 January 2019. You may need to shampoo twice in order to get all of the oil out of your hair. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Use a store-bought scalp massager if you don't want to use oils.
steps.content: Use a store-bought scalp massager if you don't want to use oils. These can be bought from drug stores or beauty stores. These tools will massage your scalp for you without the need for oil. Some may require batteries.

steps.title: Repeat two to three times a week.
steps.content: Repeat two to three times a week. It is not recommended to do scalp massages daily, as washing the oil out of your hair daily can dry it out. Instead, limit yourself to two or three times a week. You can do both dry scalp massages and scalp massages while you shampoo or condition your hair in the shower.

steps.title: Purchase rosemary and peppermint essential oils.
steps.content: Purchase rosemary and peppermint essential oils. These can likely be found in natural living stores, health food stores, and online. Rosemary and peppermint essential oils have been shown to stimulate hair growth when used during scalp massages.

steps.title: Add 3-4 drops of both essential oils to a base oil.
steps.content: Add 3-4 drops of both essential oils to a base oil. Any of the oils you used for a scalp massage can be used as a base oil. When you are doing a scalp massage with an oil, add a few drops of both the rosemary and the peppermint essential oils to the base oil. Alternatively, you can look for shampoo and/or conditioner products that have these essential oils in them already. Do not use essential oils without a base oil, or they may irritate your scalp.

steps.title: Massage the mixture into your scalp.
steps.content: Massage the mixture into your scalp. [7] X Research source Work in small circles with just your fingertips, not your fingernails. Slowly massage all around your scalp for about five minutes. You can part your hair into smaller sections, if you would like, to make sure you massage all areas.

steps.title: Leave in the oil for conditioning purposes.
steps.content: Leave in the oil for conditioning purposes. After the scalp massage, you may choose to leave the oil in for up to two hours. You can wrap your head in an old cotton t-shirt or in a light towel, or you could put your hair in a shower cap. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Wash your hair thoroughly.
steps.content: Wash your hair thoroughly. In order to remove all of the oils from your hair, you might need to shampoo your hair twice. Then, condition it as you normally would. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase a boar bristle brush with natural bristles.
steps.content: Purchase a boar bristle brush with natural bristles. In order to best stimulate your hair follicles and encourage your scalp to produce its own natural oils, a boar bristle brush with natural bristles is most recommended.

steps.title: Brush out your hair to detangle it.
steps.content: Brush out your hair to detangle it. Start brushing at the ends and slowly work your way up to the roots. You can apply a leave-in conditioner or dry conditioner before brushing to stop tangles from forming while brushing.

steps.title: Bend at the waist to flip your head upside down.
steps.content: Bend at the waist to flip your head upside down. You will temporarily stand upside down so that you can brush the underside of your hair at the back of your neck.

steps.title: Brush your hair in long, gentle strokes starting at the base of your neck.
steps.content: Brush your hair in long, gentle strokes starting at the base of your neck. Brush your hair forward over the crown of your head and down to the tips, toward the floor. Move all along the back of your neck and up to the sides of your head, beside your ears. You can also move sections of hair to brush hard-to-reach layers. Brush for 3-5 minutes.

steps.title: Straighten slowly to stand upright again.
steps.content: Straighten slowly to stand upright again. Avoid getting dizzy by standing back up slowly so that your body has time to adjust.

steps.title: Repeat brushing your hair as you did before, starting at the roots and brushing downward to the tips.
steps.content: Repeat brushing your hair as you did before, starting at the roots and brushing downward to the tips. Again, brush for another 3-5 minutes, moving all around the top of your head. Brush in slow, gentle strokes to avoid hair breakage and to stimulate the scalp. Part your hair to brush in different sections as needed.

steps.title: Repeat up to three times per day.
steps.content: Repeat up to three times per day. Brushing your hair with a natural boar bristle brush can be done up to three times per day, but doing it at least once daily is recommended.

steps.title: Purchase a few onions.
steps.content: Purchase a few onions. While it is best to make the juice in small batches so that it does not go bad, it will be helpful to have extra onions on hand for when you need to make the next batch.

steps.title: Peel the skin off the onions.
steps.content: Peel the skin off the onions. Peel it off using your fingers, or you can cut the onions into chunks, which often helps the skin come off easily.

steps.title: Decide how you will obtain the juice from the onion.
steps.content: Decide how you will obtain the juice from the onion. You have three options for doing this, based on what kind of kitchen appliances and tools you already own: A juicer: Cut the onion in small chunks and feed them through the juicer. A blender or food processor: Cut the onion into about four chunks and process the chunks in the blender or food processor. Strain the mixture through a metal strainer or cheesecloth over a bowl so that only the juice remains. A grater: Cut the onion in half and run each half over the grater. Strain the grated onion through a cheesecloth over a bowl to extract the juice.

steps.title: Test the onion juice in a small, hidden spot on your skin to test for an allergic reaction.
steps.content: Test the onion juice in a small, hidden spot on your skin to test for an allergic reaction. Fresh, pure onion juice is potent and can cause a reaction if you are allergic. Do not proceed with the rest of the steps if you are allergic.

steps.title: Apply the onion juice to your scalp and massage it in.
steps.content: Apply the onion juice to your scalp and massage it in. Carefully pour the juice over your scalp, and then use your fingertips to massage it into your scalp. Adding the massage gives the process extra power to stimulate your hair follicles.

steps.title: Leave in the onion juice for at least 30 minutes, up to one hour.
steps.content: Leave in the onion juice for at least 30 minutes, up to one hour. In order to achieve the best results, the onion juice needs to sit on your scalp for at least a half an hour.

steps.title: Wash your hair as you normally would.
steps.content: Wash your hair as you normally would. Once the time is up, shampoo and condition your hair as usual to remove the onion smell.

steps.title: Repeat three times per week.
steps.content: Repeat three times per week. It is recommended to repeat this method three times per week for best results within a couple of months.
